title: Philippians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Philippians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the letter to the Philippians?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author of the letter to the Philippians in the opening verse.

questions.question: To whom is the letter of Philippians specifically addressed?
questions.explanation: Paul addresses the letter to all the saints in Christ Jesus at Philippi.

questions.question: What does Paul thank God for in every remembrance of the Philippians?
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God for their fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now.

questions.question: What confidence does Paul express about the work God began in the Philippians?
options: It will be completed by the apostles
It will be performed until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: It will be performed until the day of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul is confident that God will perform the good work He began in them until the day of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his feelings toward the Philippians in Christ Jesus?
options: Longing in the bowels of Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Longing in the bowels of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul expresses a deep longing for the Philippians in the bowels of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul pray will abound more and more in the Philippians?
questions.explanation: Paul prays that their love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all judgment.

questions.question: What does Paul say about his imprisonment?
options: It has fallen out to the furtherance of the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: It has fallen out to the furtherance of the gospel
questions.explanation: Paul explains that his imprisonment has actually helped spread the gospel.

questions.question: According to Paul, what happens to those who preach Christ, whether in pretence or in truth?
questions.explanation: Paul rejoices that Christ is preached, regardless of the motives.

questions.question: What is Paul's attitude toward life and death as expressed in Philippians?
options: To live is gain, to die is loss
To live is Christ, to die is gain
To live is hard, to die is unknown
questions.correctAnswer: To live is Christ, to die is gain
questions.explanation: Paul states that for him, to live means to live for Christ, and to die is gain.

questions.question: What does Paul say is more needful for the Philippians, his living or his departing?
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges that it is more needful for them that he continue living.

questions.question: In chapter 2, Paul urges believers to be likeminded and have the same what?
questions.explanation: Paul encourages the Philippians to be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

questions.question: What attitude does Paul say believers should have toward one another?
options: Lowliness of mind, esteeming others better than themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Lowliness of mind, esteeming others better than themselves
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to do nothing through strife or vainglory but with humility esteem others better.

questions.question: What mind does Paul say should be in believers as was also in Christ Jesus?
questions.explanation: Paul calls believers to have the same mind as Christ, who humbled Himself.

questions.question: How did Christ Jesus humble Himself according to Philippians 2?
options: By becoming a servant and dying on the cross
questions.correctAnswer: By becoming a servant and dying on the cross
questions.explanation: Christ made Himself of no reputation, took the form of a servant, and humbled Himself to death on the cross.

questions.question: What has God given Christ because of His humility?
questions.explanation: God highly exalted Him and gave Him a name above every name.

questions.question: What will happen at the name of Jesus according to Philippians 2?
options: Every knee shall bow and every tongue confess
questions.correctAnswer: Every knee shall bow and every tongue confess
questions.explanation: At Jesusâ€™ name, every knee in heaven, earth, and under the earth shall bow and every tongue confess that He is Lord.

questions.question: What command does Paul give about working out your own salvation?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to work out their salvation with fear and trembling.

questions.question: Who does Paul say works in believers to will and to do of His good pleasure?
questions.explanation: Paul states that it is God who works in believers both to will and to do His good pleasure.

questions.question: How does Paul say believers should do all things?
questions.explanation: Believers are to do all things without murmurings and disputings.

questions.question: Who is the faithful companion Paul sends to the Philippians in chapter 2?
questions.explanation: Paul sent Epaphroditus, his brother and fellow laborer, to the Philippians.

questions.question: Why was Epaphroditus sent to the Philippians?
options: To bring gifts and report on Paul's condition
questions.correctAnswer: To bring gifts and report on Paul's condition
questions.explanation: Epaphroditus was sent to supply the Philippians' lack of service toward Paul and to report on his condition.

questions.question: What warning does Paul give concerning those who are enemies of the cross of Christ?
questions.explanation: Paul warns that the enemies of the cross have destruction as their end.

questions.question: What does Paul say about where our conversation (citizenship) is?
questions.explanation: Paul says our conversation is in heaven, from where we look for the Savior.

questions.question: What does Paul say he presses toward in Philippians 3?
options: The mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul presses toward the mark for the prize of the high calling of God in Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul say he counts all things for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus?
questions.explanation: Paul counts all things but dung for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4, what two women does Paul urge to be of the same mind?
questions.explanation: Paul beseeches Euodias and Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord.

questions.question: What does Paul command the believers to do always in Philippians 4?
questions.explanation: Paul commands the believers to rejoice in the Lord always.

questions.question: What does Paul say will keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus?
options: The peace of God which passeth all understanding
questions.correctAnswer: The peace of God which passeth all understanding
questions.explanation: The peace of God will keep hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What things does Paul say believers should think on?
options: Things true, honest, just, pure, lovely, of good report, virtue, praise
questions.correctAnswer: Things true, honest, just, pure, lovely, of good report, virtue, praise
questions.explanation: Paul lists these virtues as things that believers should think on.

questions.question: What does Paul say he has learned in whatever state he is?
questions.explanation: Paul has learned to be content in whatever state he is.

questions.question: What does Paul declare he can do through Christ which strengthens him?
questions.explanation: Paul says he can do all things through Christ which strengthens him.

questions.question: Who does Paul say had sent gifts to him while he was in prison?
questions.explanation: Paul received gifts from the Philippians through Epaphroditus.

questions.question: According to Philippians 4, how will God supply all your need?
options: According to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: According to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: God will supply all needs according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

questions.question: True or False: Paul considers the Philippians his joy and crown.
questions.explanation: Paul calls the Philippians his joy and crown in Philippians 4:1.

questions.question: True or False: In Philippians, Paul says that no man sought the things which are Jesus Christ's.
questions.explanation: Paul states that many seek their own things, not the things of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs the Philippians to murmur and dispute about their faith.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to do all things without murmurings and disputings.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that to live is Christ and to die is loss.
questions.explanation: Paul says to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

questions.question: True or False: Paul warns the Philippians to beware of evil workers and the concision.
questions.explanation: Paul warns them to beware of dogs, evil workers, and the concision.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that our citizenship is on earth.
questions.explanation: Paul says our conversation (citizenship) is in heaven.

questions.question: True or False: Paul tells the Philippians to rejoice only sometimes.
questions.explanation: Paul tells them to rejoice always and again he says rejoice.

questions.question: True or False: Epaphroditus was sick nearly unto death but God had mercy on him.
questions.explanation: Epaphroditus was sick nigh unto death, but God had mercy on him.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says that he desires the gift of the Philippians' giving and receiving.
questions.explanation: Paul desires fruit that may abound to their account, not the gift itself.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with _____ let your requests be made known unto God.'
questions.explanation: Paul instructs to pray with thanksgiving.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I can do all things through Christ which _____ me.'
questions.explanation: The KJV says Christ 'strengtheneth' me.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Let this mind be in you, which was also in _____ Jesus:'
questions.explanation: Paul urges to have the same mind as Christ Jesus.
